Docs.summary: A stateful, forward-only reader for BER-, CER-, or DER-encoded ASN.1 data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This constructor does not evaluate `data` for correctness, any correctness checks are done as part of member methods.
This constructor does not copy `data`. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the values do not change until the reader is finished.

Docs.exception: is not defined.

Docs.summary: Get a view of the content octets (bytes) of the next encoded value without advancing the reader.
Docs.returns: The bytes of the contents octets of the next encoded value.
Docs.exception: The reader is positioned at a point where the tag or length is invalid under the current encoding rules.

Docs.summary: Get a view of the next encoded value without advancing the reader. For indefinite length encodings this includes the End of Contents marker.
Docs.returns: The bytes of the next encoded value.

Docs.summary: Throws a standardized if the reader has remaining data, performs no function if returns .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This method provides a standardized target and standardized exception for reading a "closed" structure, such as the nested content for an explicitly tagged value.

Docs.param: The buffer in which to write.
On success, receives the number of bits in the last byte which were reported as "unused" by the writer.
On success, receives the number of bytes written to .
The tag to check for before reading, or for the default tag (Universal 1).
